scenarioDescription:
The K2-188 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-188 is a star with 1.06 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.19 times its radius. It is located 1457.33 light years away from the solar system.

K2-188 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-188 system


K2-188 b

K2-188 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-188 b is 2.391 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-188 b is 1.350 that of Earth. At 2.391 Earth masses, K2-188 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


K2-188 c

K2-188 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-188 c is 8.395 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-188 c is 2.830 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-188 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-188, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-188 - System With 2 Exolanets
